The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

wikitext.*:
{{disambig-two|the Watchers in Minas Morgul|the Watchers at [[Cirith Ungol]]|[[Two Watchers]]}}
[[File:Lída Holubová - Minas Morgul.jpg|thumb|250px|right|"[[Minas Morgul]]" by [[Lída Holubová]]]]
The '''Silent Watchers''' were sentinels in [[Minas Morgul]] with the ability to notice movement on the road that led to and passed by the gate of Minas Morgul.

==History==
[[Gollum]] told [[Frodo]] and [[Sam]] that the Silent Watchers, things inside Minas Morgul knew of movement on the road that climbed under the shadow of the walls of Minas Morgul and passed the gate of Minas Morgul.<ref>{{TT|Gate}}, p. 642</ref>

On [[13 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019 March 13</ref> [[Gorbag]], the leader of the [[Orcs]] from Minas Morgul, told [[Shagrat]], the leader of the Orcs from the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]], that "our" Silent Watchers had been uneasy more than two days ago.<ref>{{TT|Choices}}, p. 738</ref> This corresponds with [[10 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019 March 10</ref> when Frodo, Sam and Gollum left the road that led to Minas Morgul before the bridge over the river [[Morgulduin]] to climb the [[Stairs of Cirith Ungol]].<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 499</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings - The Return of the King - Minas Morgul Statues.png|thumb|350px|right|Watcher statues outside [[Minas Morgul]] - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'']]
'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
:Posted at the edge of the bridge to [[Minas Morgul]], [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] and [[Gollum]] encounter "Two Huge, Bestial[,]" "Hideous" "Stone Statues".<ref name = "Script">[https://thescriptsavant.com/movies/Lord_Of_The_Rings_The_Return_Of_The_King.pdf LORD OF THE RINGS The Return of the King]</ref> Gollum tells the [[Hobbits]] to be "Quick!" as "they will see." This line of dialogue may refer to the [[Nazgûl]], though the camera pans to Frodo walking to them and close-ups are shown of the ominous statues.

:[[Andy Serkis]] compared them to [[wikipedia:Gargoyle|Gargoyles]]. [[Elijah Wood]] centered his performance around them, as the city Minas Morgul was not visible to the actors.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f8Ci6vCPOoY&t=3300 THE RETURN OF THE KING - Disc 1 Cast Commentary]</ref>
